FDG.function_description: Earth Map app: location/tracking feature hub

This page functions as a subscription offer screen for the GPS Camera Pro upgrade, showcasing the features available in the Pro version, presenting weekly and lifetime subscription plans with pricing, and providing a button to start the subscription, along with links to terms and conditions and privacy policy.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the offer button to enter the subscription screen. On the subscription screen, the user can choose between a weekly or lifetime plan (via their respective buttons) or directly click the start subscription button. After selecting a plan (or not, if default is used) and clicking 'Start subscription', the flow proceeds to the payment page (or relevant destination).

steps.summary: Click the offer button to navigate to the subscription screen
Select the weekly subscription plan
Select the lifetime subscription plan
Click the start subscription button to proceed to payment

branches.condition: User clicks start subscription without changing plan

FDG.function_description: The Settings page of the Earth Map app allows users to configure various app preferences (map type, date/time/date format/time format/temperature format) and access options to rate the app or view the privacy policy.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the initial page and clicks the Settings gear icon to navigate to the Settings page, where various app preferences (map type, date/time/date format/time format/temperature format) and options to rate the app or view the privacy policy are accessible.

steps.summary: Click the Settings gear icon to open the Settings page.

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a subscription offer screen for the GPS Camera Pro upgrade in the Earth Map app, allowing users to view Pro vs. Free feature differences, select a weekly or lifetime payment plan, and start a subscription to unlock all premium features.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the welcome page (page 0). The user clicks the 'Earth 3D feature card' (or related element) to navigate to the subscription offer page (page 1), where they can view Pro vs. Free features, select a plan, and start a subscription. This is a straight-line flow with no branches yet, as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click the Earth 3D feature card (or related element) to navigate to the subscription offer page.

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a subscription offer screen for the GPS Camera Pro upgrade, comparing free vs. pro features (e.g., unlimited tracking, 3D Earth, ad removal) and presenting weekly/lifetime payment plans to unlock premium capabilities.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. The user clicks the 'Video Live feature card' (or equivalent interactive element) to navigate to page 1, which displays the GPS Camera Pro subscription offer, comparing free and pro features and presenting payment plans. This is a straight-line flow with no branches yet.

steps.summary: Click the interactive element (e.g., Video Live feature card) to navigate to the subscription offer page.

FDG.function_description: The "Select Template" page in the Earth Map app allows users to choose from various location - themed templates, each of which displays details like the location name, time, date, weather, temperature, and sometimes a map or landscape image, likely for use in location - related tracking or display features.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'Select Template' feature card to enter the template selection page. Once there, the user can choose from multiple location - themed templates (like Meghalaya, Moscow, etc.) by clicking on them. There's also an option to go back to the previous page using the back navigation arrow. The main flow is selecting a template, with the back action as an alternative.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Select Template' feature card to navigate to the template selection page.
Click the back navigation arrow button to return to the previous page.
Click on the 'Meghalaya, India' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'Moscow, Russia' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'VIC, Australia' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'Oberosterreich, Austria' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'Wales, UK' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'Marble Street, Turkey' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'Unnamed (building)' template card to select this location - themed template.
Click on the 'Athens, Greece' template card to select this location - themed template.

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a camera interface within the Earth Map app’s Capture Image feature, allowing users to take photos or record videos while displaying location, time, weather, and temperature information, and providing options to set location, switch between photo/video modes, and access camera settings like flash, grid, timer, and rotation.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the Capture Image feature card (S1) to enter the camera interface. Then, from the camera interface (S2), users can choose to click the PHOTO tab (S3) to switch to photo mode or click the Rotate camera button (S4) to rotate the camera view, with these two actions being mutually exclusive options at the camera interface step.

steps.summary: Click Capture Image feature card to enter camera interface
Reach camera interface with location/time/weather and mode/settings options
Click PHOTO tab button to switch to photo mode
Click Rotate camera button to rotate camera view

FDG.function_description: The current page of the Earth Map app serves as a feature hub for location/tracking - related functionalities, and the "Edit Existing Images" feature card (when accessed) likely allows users to modify or enhance previously captured or selected images, likely with location - related or template - based customizations, as part of the app's suite of location - centric and image - related tools.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'Edit Existing Images' feature card on the main hub page (page 0) to navigate to the image editing page (page 5). On page 5, the user can either select images (via checkboxes) to edit or use the back arrow to return to the main hub. If returning, clicking the back arrow takes them to page 39, and optionally, a 'Play video' button on page 39 can loop back to page 5 to resume image selection/editing.

steps.summary: Click 'Edit Existing Images' card to go to image editing page
Click back arrow to go to page 39
Click 'Play video' button to return to image editing page
Click first photo checkbox to select image
Click second photo checkbox to select image
Click third photo checkbox to select image
Click fourth photo checkbox to select image

FDG.function_description: This page serves as a welcome screen for the Earth Map app, prompting users to continue to access features for exploring the world, connecting with friends, and tracking moments, with a visual of a 3D map and friend avatars.
data_out: viewed location wise images feature card

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Earth Map welcome page. They click on the 'View Location Wise Images' feature card, which keeps them on the same page (possibly to explore or confirm the feature).

steps.summary: Click on the 'View Location Wise Images' feature card

FDG.function_description: The current page serves as a welcome screen for the Earth Map app, prompting users to continue to access features for exploring the world, connecting with friends, and tracking moments, after closing the subscription popup.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the subscription popup page (page 1). They click the close button to dismiss the popup, transitioning to the welcome screen (page 0). From there, the flow ends as the welcome screen is reached, allowing access to app features.

steps.summary: Click the close button on the subscription popup to dismiss it and go to the welcome screen.

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to review the features of the GPS Camera Pro subscription (including unlimited friend tracking, GPS photo data, 3D/Live Earth, and ad removal) and select a weekly ($1.99) or lifetime ($19.99) subscription plan to unlock all Pro features, with an option to start the subscription.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the subscription review page, where they can view Pro features. They may click the Terms & Conditions link (at the bottom) to view its content, with the page remaining the same after the click.

steps.summary: Click the Terms & Conditions link (at the bottom of the subscription page)

FDG.function_description: The current page (opened via the Privacy Policy link from the subscription plan selection page) is a Chrome browser window likely intended to display the privacy policy details for the GPS Camera Pro subscription associated with the Live Earth 3D & Satellite Map app.

core_logic.logic: From the subscription plan selection page (page 1), the user clicks the 'Privacy Policy' link. This action opens a Chrome browser window (page 7) to display the privacy policy details for the GPS Camera Pro subscription associated with the app. The flow is a straight line with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the Privacy Policy link on the subscription plan selection page

FDG.function_description: The current page displays an advertisement for the Lemon8 app, featuring an option to install the app from the Google Play Store and a video promoting the app.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the settings page (page 2). The user clicks the back arrow button, which navigates to the page displaying the Lemon8 app advertisement (page 8). There are no branches or loops in this straight - line flow.

steps.summary: Click the back arrow button on the settings page

FDG.function_description: This page (within the app's settings) displays a calendar interface for selecting a date, likely to set or modify a date - related parameter for the app (such as a date - based filter or schedule related to the map or location - tracking features), with options to cancel or confirm the selected date.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the settings page and clicks the 'Change Date' button (not in the provided actions, but assuming the calendar popup is opened). Then, on the calendar popup, the user can either click 'CANCEL' to close the popup without changing the date or click 'OK' to confirm the selected date. However, since the provided actions are about map type, there's a mismatch. Wait, the functional point is about date selection, but the actions given are for map type. Oh, maybe a mistake. But following the instructions, perhaps the user intended. Wait, the actions list has actions for map type, but the functional point is date. Maybe the actions are wrong, but the task is to process. Wait, the user's functional point is about date selection, but the actions provided are for map type. This is a problem. But according to the task, we have to use the given actions. Wait, maybe the user made a mistake. But proceeding, perhaps the functional point is map type. Let's re-express. The user is on page 2 (settings), clicks 'Change Map Type' (action [2,1]) to open page 9 (map type popup). Then, on page 9, the user can choose to close the popup (action [9,0]), or select Normal (9,1), Satellite (9,2), Terrain (9,3), or Hybrid (9,4). So the logic: Start on settings page (page 2), click 'Change Map Type' to open the map type popup (page 9). At the popup, the user can either close it (click 'Close' button) or select one of the four map types (Normal, Satellite, Terrain, Hybrid).

Click 'Close' button on map type popup
Click 'Normal' map type button
Click 'Satellite' map type button

FDG.function_description: This page (or pop - up) enables users to select a specific date from the December 2025 calendar, with options to cancel or confirm the selection, likely for a feature related to date - based configuration or scheduling within the Earth Map app's settings context.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the settings page. The user clicks the 'Change Date' button, which opens a calendar popup for December 2025. From here, the user can select a date, then choose to cancel or confirm the selection (though the provided action only covers opening the calendar).

steps.summary: Click 'Change Date' button to open December 2025 calendar popup

FDG.function_description: This page (a time - setting modal) enables users to set or adjust the time (including choosing between AM and PM) for the Earth Map app, with options to confirm the change via “OK” or cancel it via “CANCEL”.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'Change Time' button to open the time - setting modal. In the modal, users can choose to set the time period to AM or PM, select the hour, and then either cancel the change (returning to the previous page) or confirm the change (also returning to the previous page) by clicking the respective buttons.

steps.summary: Click 'Change Time' button to open time - setting modal
Click 'AM/PM toggle button (AM)' to set time to AM
Click 'AM/PM toggle button (PM)' to set time to PM
Click 'Clock hour selection (7)' to set hour to 7
Click 'Cancel button' to cancel time change and return
Click 'OK button' to confirm time change and return

FDG.function_description: This page (a modal within the app's settings) allows the user to select the temperature format (°C, °F, or K) for the Earth Map app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the settings page (page 2). First, they click the 'Change Date Format' button (action_ref [2,4]) to open the date format selection popup (navigating to page 11). Then, they click to close the date format popup (action_ref [11,0]), returning to the previous page (page 22, though likely back to the settings context).

steps.summary: Click 'Change Date Format' button to open date format popup
Click to close date format selection popup

FDG.function_description: The current page (a modal within the app's settings) allows the user to select a temperature format (°C, °F, or K) for the Earth Map app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the settings page (page 2). They click the 'Change Temperature Format' button, which opens a modal (page 11) displaying temperature format options (°C, °F, K). FDG.function_description: The current page (a modal within the app's settings) allows the user to select a temperature format (°C, °F, or K) for the Earth Map app.

FDG.function_description: This page (triggered by the "Rate App" action in the settings of the Earth Map app) allows users to rate the app by selecting a star rating (from 1 to 5 stars) and then proceeding to submit their rating via the "Rate" button, with a message thanking users for their support and requesting a rating.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the settings page (page 2). They click the 'Rate App' button, which triggers a dialog to appear with a thank-you message and a star rating interface, moving to page 12. This is the core flow to access the app rating interface.

steps.summary: Click the 'Rate App' button on the settings page to open the rating dialog.

FDG.function_description: The current page displays the Privacy Policy for the Earth Map app, detailing the app's policies and procedures regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of user information, along with user privacy rights and legal protections.
